Bangunan Rusak, Ruang Kelas SDN Sirnasari Kabupaten Tasikmalaya Ditopang Kayu
04 Nov 2019, 12:27 by Bambang Arifianto
SINGAPARNA, (PR).- Kondisi mengenaskan bangunan sekolah yang rusak dan mengancam keselamatan para murid terus terjadi di Kabupaten Tasikmalaya. Keadaan tersebut terjadi di Sekolah Dasar Negeri Sirnasari di Kampung Rancapeundeuy, Desa Sirnasari, Kecamatan Sariwangi yang atapnya ditopang kayu lantaran bangunan telah rusak. 
Kerusakan terjadi hampir di seluruh ruang kelas dan guru sekolah tersebut. Sejumlah kusen tampak keropos dengan jendela tanpa kaca. Atap kelas juga ada yang berlubang. Kondisi terparah terlihat di ruang kelas IV yang ditopang beberapa kayu lantaran atapnya telah turun. Sovie, 31 tahun, guru kelas IV mengungkapkan, suasana belajar menjadi tak nyaman lantaran penghuni kelas kerap waswas karena kerusakan ruang kelas. "Khawatir, apalagi sekarang musim hujan," kata Sovie saat ditemui di sekolah itu, Senin 4 November 2019. Sovie risau lantaran kondisi atap atau eternit serta kerangka penyangganya sudah turun. 
Turunnya hujan semakin memperbesar potensi ambruknya atap kelas yang sudah ditopang kayu itu. ‎"Upami musim hujan, gegebegan (kalau musim hujan semakin 'dagdigdug')," ucapnya. Jangankan hujan, eternit  sempat jatuh ketika kemarau masih melanda Kabupaten Tasikmalaya empat bulan lalu. Karuan saja Sovie dan para muridnya yang tengah belajar kaget karena material atap tiba-tiba jatuh. "Untung tidak kena siswa," ujar Sovie. Bangku siswa pun digeser lebih maju guna menghindari kejadian serupa.  Akibatnya area mengajar Sovie di depan kelas semakin sempit.
Tak hanya itu, kerusakan bangunan membuat ruang kelas kerap bocor ketika hujan. Bila sudah begitu, siswa-siswa terpaksa mengepel dulu atau mengeluarkan genangan air dari dalam kelas. Kegiatan belajar pun akhirnya dilakukan dengan lesehan karena bangku dan meja digeser akibat kelas yang bocor. Sovie menambahkan, murid-muridnya juga bisa dipindahkan ke ruang kelas III jika kegiatan belajar sudah tak memungkinkan lagi.
Kelas III pun dibagi menjadi dua ruang belajar dengan dipisah papan tulis sekaligus dua guru berbeda yang mengajar. Kerusakan yang menimpa seluruh bangunan sekolah  membuat ruang kelas IV dan V juga menjadi tempat menampung buku-buku perpustakaan dan alat peraga. Keterbatasan sarana prasarana membuat semangat para murid belajar ikut agak berkurang. Siswa dan guru diliputi kerisauan sebagai imbas tidak laiknya ruang kelas. "Tidak kondusif dalam pembelajaran, waswas juga ditambah sekarang (musim) hujan," tuturnya. Sovie tak habis pikir dengan keadaan tersebut. Di satu sisi, pembelajaran tetap harus berjalan. Tetapi, bangunan sarana prasarana tidak menunjang.
Hal senada dikemukakan guru SD Negeri Sirnasari lainnya, Irwan Sohibul, 40 tahun. Guru kelas V itu mengungkapkan, kerusakan bangunan sudah terjadi sejak tiga tahun lalu. Kerusakan terjadi lantaran bangunan sekolah memang suda tua dan belum mendapat perbaikan berupa renovasi atau rehabilitas. SD Negeri Sirnasari, lanjutnya, berdiri pada sekira 1972 dan sempat berstatus sebagai SD Inpres. Dari seluruh bangunan yang rusak, Irwan paling risau dengan kondisi ruang kelas empat yang sambunga kerangka kayu bagian atapnya telah bergeser. Ia mengatakan, upaya permohonan bantuan telah sering diajukan kepada pemerintah. "Mengajukan (proposal bantuan perbaikan) kurang lebih sudah tiga kali," ujarnya.



Bahkan, pihak UPTD pendidikan Sariwangi pernah datang melihat langsung kondisi sekolah. Namun belum ada langkah nyata guna memperbaiki kerusakan sekola. "Belum turun bantuan ril, baru disurvey," tuturnya. Dalam sistem Dapodik, Irwan mengaku telah memasukan data dan memperbaharuinya sesuai dengan keadaan nyata bangunan yang rusak. Bahkan, kondisi sekolah sempat pula diangkat dalam pemberitaan beberapa media massa. Dari pernyataan Kepala Sekolah Ade Supriadi, lanjut Irwan, sudah ada sinyal positif bakal ada alokasi kucuran bantuan ke sekolahnya tahun ini. Tetapi, Irwan tidak mengetahui bantuan itu berasal dari APBD Kabupaten Tasikmalaya atau langsung pemerintah pusat.
Irwan hanya berharap pemberian bantuan perbaikan sekolah segera bisa mengucur karena keadaan bangunan yang sudah mengkhawatirkan. Ia mencontohkan, gempa bumi yang terjadi belum lama ini dan terasa hingga Tasikmalaya membuat murid dan guru panik. "Cepat-cepat dikeluarkan murid-murid," ujarnya. Jika hujan, Irwan mengatakan, kegiatan belajar mengajar dipindahkan ke luar atau pelataran kelas guna menghindari hal-hal buruk terjadi akibat bangunan sudah tak laik. Ia mengatakan, jumlah total murid  SD Negeri Sirnasari mencapai 139 siswa. Sekolah tersebut menjadi tumpuan tempat bersekolah siswa-siswa dari lima RT di Desa Sirnasari. Beberapa murid ada juga yang berasal dari Cilutung, Desa Linggasirna.
Bangunan sekolah rusak menjadi pemandangan jamak yang terjadi di Kabupaten Tasikmalaya. Dalam catata "PR" terdapat dua SD negeri lain yang rusak dan disangga. Kedua sekolah tersebut yakni SD Negeri 1 Ciawang, Desa Ciawang, Kecamatan Leuwisari dan SD Negeri Pasirhuni 02, Desa Pasirhuni, Kecamatan Ciawi.***

Damaged Building, Sirnasari Elementary School Classroom in Tasikmalaya Regency Supported by Timber
Nov 04 2019, 12:27 by Bambang Arifianto
SINGAPARNA, (PR) .- Conditions of devastating school buildings that threaten the safety of students continue to occur in Tasikmalaya District. The situation occurred at Sirnasari Public Elementary School in Rancapeundeuy Village, Sirnasari Village, Sariwangi District whose roof was supported by wood because the building had been damaged.
Damage occurred in almost all classrooms and school teachers. Some sills look porous with windows without glass. There is also a class roof with holes. The worst condition is seen in Class IV supported by some wood because the roof has dropped. Sovie, 31, a grade IV teacher, revealed that the learning atmosphere was uncomfortable because the classmates were often worried because of classroom damage. "I'm worried, especially now that it's the rainy season," Sovie said when met at the school on Monday, November 4, 2019. Sovie was worried because the condition of the roof or plasterboard and the supporting frame had dropped.
The falling rain further increased the potential for collapse of the roof of the class that had been supported by the wood. "Upami is the rainy season, noisy (if the rainy season is getting 'dagdigdug')," he said. Let alone rain, plasterboard had fallen when the drought still hit Tasikmalaya District four months ago. Of course, Sovie and her students who were learning were shocked because the roof material suddenly fell. "Luckily it didn't hit the students," Sovie said. The student bench was moved forward to avoid similar incidents. As a result, Sovie's teaching area in front of the class was increasingly narrow.
Not only that, building damage often makes classrooms leak when it rains. If so, students are forced to mop first or remove standing water from the classroom. Learning activities were finally carried out on a stretch because the benches and tables were shifted due to a leaky class. Sovie added, her students could also be moved to class III if learning activities were no longer possible.
Class III was divided into two study rooms with separate whiteboards as well as two different teachers who taught. The damage that happened to the entire school building made class IV and V also a place to store library books and teaching aids. Limited infrastructure means that the enthusiasm of students to learn is also somewhat reduced. Students and teachers are filled with concerns as a result of inadequate classrooms. "Not conducive to learning, we are also being wary now (in the rainy season)," he said. Sovie could not understand the situation. On the one hand, learning must continue. However, building infrastructure does not support.
The same thing was stated by another Sirnasari Elementary School teacher, Irwan Sohibul, 40 years old. The fifth grade teacher revealed that building damage had occurred three years ago. The damage occurred because the school building was indeed old and had not yet received repairs in the form of renovations or rehabilitation. Sirnasari Public Elementary School, he continued, was established in 1972 and was once the Presidential Inpres Elementary School. Of all the buildings that were damaged, Irwan was most concerned about the condition of the fourth grade room which had a shift in the wooden framework of the roof. He said efforts to appeal for help had often been submitted to the government. "Submitting (proposal for assistance to improve) has been more or less three times," he said.



In fact, the UPTD Sariwangi education never came to see firsthand the condition of the school. But there are no concrete steps to repair school damage. "Real aid has not yet come down, then surveyed," he said. In the Dapodik system, Irwan claimed to have entered data and updated it in accordance with the actual condition of the damaged building. In fact, the condition of the school was also raised in the news of several mass media. From the statement of Principal Ade Supriadi, continued Irwan, there was already a positive signal that there would be an allocation of aid disbursement to his school this year. However, Irwan did not know that the assistance came from the Tasikmalaya District Budget or directly from the central government.
Irwan only hoped that the provision of assistance for school repairs could immediately be disbursed due to the worrisome condition of the building. He gave an example, the earthquake that occurred recently and felt that Tasikmalaya made students and teachers panic. "Students are expelled quickly," he said. If it rains, Irwan said, teaching and learning activities are moved outside or in the classroom to avoid bad things happening because the building is not feasible. He said the total number of Sirnasari Elementary School students reached 139 students. The school is a place of support for students from five RTs in Sirnasari Village. Some students also came from Cilutung, Linggasirna Village.
The school building was damaged into a plural scene that occurred in Tasikmalaya District. In the notes "PR" there are two other public elementary schools that are damaged and supported. The two schools are SD Negeri 1 Ciawang, Desa Ciawang, Kecamatan Leuwisari and SD Negeri Pasirhuni 02, Desa Pasirhuni, Kecamatan Ciawi. ***
